sentences.english: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.
sentences.chinese: 若忽然遭杀害之祸，他必戏笑无辜的人遇难。

sentences.english: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki- moon has also extended his condolences.
sentences.chinese: 联合国秘书长潘基文也对巴西火灾遇难者表示哀悼。

sentences.english: Forty-six South Korean sailors died in the March 26 incident.
sentences.chinese: 在3月26日的事件中，有46名韩国船员遇难。

sentences.english: Mothers of the sailors wailed as they clasped their sons’ photos and the urns containing their ashes.
sentences.chinese: 遇难官兵的母亲紧抱孩子照片和骨灰盒，嚎啕恸哭。

sentences.english: The remaining victim, Boote, was also from the Royal Military police.
sentences.chinese: 另一名遇难者布特也来自皇家宪兵队。

sentences.english: He is ordering flags at all government buildings to be flown at half-staff in honor of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 他已下令所有政府大楼降半旗悼念遇难者。

sentences.english: Unclaimed bodies of the victims, such as rehabilitation work is under way.
sentences.chinese: 遇难者遗体认领等善后工作也正在展开。

sentences.english: The captain rationed the remaining water out among the shipwrecked passengers.
sentences.chinese: 船长将剩余的水分发给遇难船只中的乘客。

sentences.english: Memorial to the victims of genocide.
sentences.chinese: 种族大屠杀遇难者纪念碑。

sentences.english: Among the dead was Laith Misha'an, the leader of the local pro-government Sunni militia.
sentences.chinese: 其中一名遇难者为当地支持政府派逊尼派义勇军领袖。

sentences.english: Many people have disappeared after the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 轰炸之后许多人遇难了。

sentences.english: Eight policemen have been killed in an attack on a police checkpoint in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 八名警察在墨西哥一个警察检查站遭遇的袭击中遇难。

sentences.english: By then I realised that my survival was a miracle.
sentences.chinese: 此时，我才意识到我的幸免遇难是个奇迹。

sentences.english: The pilot of the first copter was pinned in the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 第一架直升机的飞行员被困在了飞机里，遇难了。

sentences.english: He said that Du Zhaoyu, who was killed in the air raids, is an outstanding son of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 他说，中国遇难人员杜照宇是中国人民的优秀儿子。

sentences.english: They were beaten.  Some were killed.
sentences.chinese: 他们筋疲力尽，有的还遇难了。

definition: to die in an accident or disaster/to be killed
(of a plane, ship etc) to have an accident (plane crash, shipwreck, vehicle collision etc)/to mess things up
to die in the line of duty
